name: hc_wastewater_h2s_fz
description: [HC] H2S wastewater + GDB FZ ‚Üí BLOCK (zinc attacked), suggest SF
query: Wastewater plant exhaust. Hydrogen Sulfide (H2S) present. We want GDB in FZ.

turns.content: Wastewater plant exhaust. Hydrogen Sulfide (H2S) present. We want GDB in FZ.

This GDB filter housing configuration for your wastewater plant exhaust is blocked. The presence of H2S / Hydrogen Sulfide Corrosion and Chemical Vapor Exposure means that the requested GDB housing with FZ (C3) material is unsuitable. The housing corrosion class is C2.The GDB housing also uses SINGLE_WALL_UNINSULATED construction which does not meet the leakage class and hygiene requirements for a wastewater environment. A solution would need to be rated for ENV_WASTEWATER installation, using a material with corrosion class C5 or higher, and provide activated carbon adsorption to remove chemical vapors. Unfortunately, no standard catalog product currently satisfies all of these requirements simultaneously. I recommend contacting our Custom Engineering or Technical Support team with these specific technical requirements.

gemini.explanation: The system correctly identifies a critical engineering mismatch. It accurately pulls data from the PDF regarding the GDB housing's corrosion class (C2) and construction (single-wall), and correctly applies HVAC engineering principles to determine that galvanized steel is unsuitable for a wastewater environment containing H2S. The recommendation to seek custom engineering for a C5-rated carbon solution is the safest and most professional advice given the catalog limitations.

dimension_explanations.correctness: Correctly identifies GDB as C2 and single-wall (PDF p.8) and correctly assesses FZ as unsuitable for H2S environments.
dimension_explanations.completeness: Fully addresses the user's request, explains why it is rejected, and provides the necessary requirements for a valid solution (C5 material, carbon filtration).
dimension_explanations.safety: Excellent safety block; installing galvanized steel in an H2S environment would lead to rapid corrosion and failure.
dimension_explanations.tone: Professional, direct, and authoritative regarding the technical constraints.
dimension_explanations.reasoning_quality: Clear logical progression: H2S requires high corrosion resistance -> GDB is C2/Galvanized -> Configuration blocked.
dimension_explanations.constraint_adherence: Strictly adheres to engineering best practices for corrosion protection and application suitability.

strengths: Accurate distinction between material raw rating (FZ=C3 on p.4) and product rating (GDB=C2 on p.8)
Sound engineering judgment regarding H2S corrosion risks
Correct identification that GDB is not suitable for gas-phase filtration requirements

openai.explanation: Correctly blocks FZ/galvanized GDB for an H2S wastewater exhaust on corrosion grounds, but it misstates key product facts (GDB is specified as C2 in the text, and it is not simply ‚Äúsingle-wall uninsulated‚Äù in the way described). It also overreaches by claiming no standard catalog product can meet the need, despite the catalog offering higher-corrosion materials and carbon housings (GDC/GDMI FLEX) that could be configured for adsorption duty.

dimension_explanations.correctness: PDF shows GDB is for inomhusbruk and has Fl√∂de 3400 m¬≥/h at 600x600 (GDB table), but the response incorrectly states ‚Äúhousing corrosion class is C2‚Äù while also calling FZ ‚ÄúC3‚Äù and mischaracterizes GDB construction; corrosion-block reasoning for H2S is sound.
dimension_explanations.completeness: Does not ask for key missing parameters (airflow, size WxH, temperature/RH, indoor/outdoor, required removal efficiency, media type) and does not propose a viable standard alternative selection from the catalog.
dimension_explanations.safety: Appropriately flags H2S corrosion risk and blocks galvanized/FZ for wastewater exhaust, which is prudent.
dimension_explanations.tone: Professional, clear, and appropriately cautionary for a technical sales/engineering context.
dimension_explanations.reasoning_quality: Reasoning is partially transparent (corrosion class step-up to C5), but includes unsupported claims about leakage/hygiene requirements and an absolute 'no product' conclusion without checking catalog alternatives.
dimension_explanations.constraint_adherence: Violates catalog/engineering constraints by asserting GDB is single-wall uninsulated and unsuitable on leakage/hygiene grounds, and by claiming no standard product fits despite catalog carbon housings and higher-corrosion materials being available.

strengths: Correctly identifies H2S as a severe corrosion driver and rejects galvanized/FZ for wastewater exhaust service.
Keeps recommendation conservative and escalates to technical support when uncertain.
weaknesses: Contains factual inconsistencies about corrosion class and construction (GDB has an insulated double-skin service door per PDF; not purely 'single-wall uninsulated' as stated).
Overly absolute conclusion that no standard catalog product can meet requirements, without considering GDC/GDC FLEX/GDMI FLEX carbon solutions and available C5 materials (RF/SF/ZM).

Material page: FZ Z275 stated as korrosivitetsklass C3; RF (EN 1.4301) korrosivitetsklass C5; ZM310 korrosivitetsklass C5 (MATERIAL section).

content_segments.text: This GDB filter housing configuration for your wastewater plant exhaust is blocked. The presence of

content_segments.inference_logic: H2S (hydrogen sulfide) aggressively attacks zinc coatings. FZ (C3 galvanized) corrodes rapidly in H2S environments. Minimum C5 material required (RF or SF).
Gas/odor/VOC removal requires activated carbon adsorption. Mechanical filters cannot capture gas-phase contaminants.

Unfortunately, no standard catalog product currently satisfies all of these requirements simultaneously.
